channel.title: Gaming Heads Figures
channel.description:
Valve has always offered great deals on their video games. Just look at the Orange Box, it was labeled "the best deal in video game history". Steam constantly offers ridiculously low prices on games in sales. Why would they suddenly go with a super-high priced collectible line instead of a cheaper, mass-produced line? Even from just a marketing standpoint, wouldn't they make more from a ton of $20 toys then a few $245 statues?
What do you think? Would you buy Valve's figures if they had an affordable option? Would you buy the ones they're offering now?
Me, I'd love to have Gordon, Alyx, a vort, a Heavy, an Engy, Louis, Zoey, Francis, and Bill lined up on my desk, but at current prices all I'd be able to think when I looked at them is that I really paid over $2000 for these guys.

item.description:
I could make one for cheaper.

I would NOT give them more money for cheap (production-wise) little, worthless (yet expensive) dolls. Stick to teh gaems.

item.title: Gaming Heads Figures
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Combine:

I didn’t even know Valve made action figures. Mini companion cubes, maybe, but dolls?

Like nutsack elaborately said, they’re collectables for rich people with money to throw.

They didn’t, but just a few days ago they announced they were releasing figures from all their franchises. So far the only one out for pre-order is a giant 12" hand-painted $230-$245 heavy.

The website says “Gaming Heads will be bringing out a whole range of different products” so hopefully we’ll see some cheaper stuff later on.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Heads Figures
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
If these things were $20 i’d probably buy one of anything they’d make, especially if they were posable, because I’m a dork like that. I’m not even going to consider it since they’re so damn expensive.

I even thought about making my own figures, but I’m too lazy, cheap & anal retentive to actually do it.
